enWisdom: Knowledge is loftiness, ignorance is misguidance

Wisdom: الشَّقِيُّ [التَّقِيُ‏] مَنِ اغْتَرَّ بِحَالِهِ وَانْخَدَعَ لِغُرُورِ آمَالِهِ
enWisdom: The wretched is one who is proud of his condition and is beguiled by the deception of his hopes
The height of foolishness is being beguiled [by the pleasures of this world]
Let not the Deceiver deceive you concerning Allah

Wisdom: جِمَاعُ الْغُرُورِ فِي الِاسْتِنَامَةِ إِلَى الْعَدُوِّ
enWisdom: The consolidation of delusion is in sleeping with ease in the presence of the enemy

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ لَمْ تَقْتُلْهُ قَاتِلَاتُ الْغُرُورِ
enWisdom: Blessed be the one who has not been killed by the lethal poisons of deception
How many a person has been deluded by what is concealed from him

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ غُرُوراً أَنْ يَثِقَ بِكُلِّ مَا تُسَوِّلُ لَهُ نَفْسُهُ
enWisdom: It is enough of a delusion for a person to trust all that his soul lures him towards

Wisdom: لَيْسَ كُلُّ مَغْرُورٍ بِنَاجٍ وَلَا كُلُّ طَالِبٍ بِمُحْتَاجٍ
enWisdom: Neither is every deluded person saved, nor is every seeker needy
One who considers himself to be more [important or powerful than others] becomes less

Wisdom: مَنِ اغْتَرَّ بِحَالِهِ قَصَّرَ عَنِ احْتِيَالِهِ
enWisdom: One who is deluded by his condition, reduces his efforts

Wisdom: مَنْ جَهِلَ اغْتَرَّ بِنَفْسِهِ وَكَانَ يَوْمُهُ شَرّاً مِنْ أَمْسِهِ
enWisdom: One who is ignorant becomes self-conceited; and his ‘today’ is worse than his ‘yesterday’

Wisdom: لَا تَبْطَرَنَّ بِالظَّفَرِ فَإِنَّكَ لَا تَأْمَنُ ظَفَرَ الزَّمَانِ بِكَ
enWisdom: Never become vain because of [your] victory, for indeed you are not safe from the victory of time over you
The intelligent person is never found [to be] beguiled
